question: Which is the only Indian city to feature in the ‘Top 30 Start-up Ecosystem list’ released by Start-up Genome?
explanation:
Startup Genome has released a report titled ‘The Global Startup Ecosystem Report 2020’. The report analyses cities where early stage start-ups can build global success.
Bengaluru was the only Indian city to feature in the Top 30 Start-up Ecosystem. It is followed by Delhi in the 36th place. Bengaluru was selected for high access to funding and Delhi, for the volume and complexity of patent creation. The list was topped by Silicon Valley in California, followed by London and New York in the second spot.
